function: Provide a drag-and-drop interface for users to create and edit diagrams.
static_description: The canvas area features a ghost white background where users can place diagram elements. Sidebar contains draggable components categorized by diagram type, rendered with slate gray borders and icons.

interaction_and_states.description: Users can drag elements from the sidebar onto the canvas to add them to the diagram. Elements can also be moved around within the canvas after placement.
Clicking on an element selects it, enabling resizing handles and property panels.
Right-clicking on an element opens a context menu with options like delete, duplicate, or bring forward/send backward.

function: Allow users to choose between different types of diagrams when starting a new creation session.
static_description: A horizontal selector bar at the top displays available diagram types as labeled icons. Each option is visually distinct but unified under a consistent theme using slate gray accents.

interaction_and_states.description: Selecting a diagram type loads corresponding templates and default settings into the workspace.

function: Enable users to start creating a new diagram from scratch.
static_description: A prominent 'New Diagram' button appears in the header navigation bar, styled with slate gray text and border against a ghost white backdrop.

interaction_and_states.description: Opens a modal prompting the user to select a diagram type before initializing a blank canvas.

resource_dependency.editToolsPanel: Contains buttons for Add Element, Remove Element, Modify Properties, Undo/Redo actions.
resource_dependency.elementModificationModal: Displays form fields for editing selected element properties such as label, color, size, etc.

function: Allow modification of existing diagrams through addition, removal, and adjustment of individual elements.
static_description: An inline toolbar appears near selected elements showing relevant editing tools. Contextual modals appear upon initiating edits to configure detailed attributes.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking Add Element reveals palette of available shapes/text boxes/etc. Clicking Remove deletes currently selected item(s). Clicking Modify shows editable fields.
Directly edits text labels of nodes or connection lines if supported by the current diagram mode.

resource_dependency.styleAdjustmentSidebar: Includes controls for font styles, line thickness, node colors, spacing parameters.

function: Offer granular control over visual presentation and arrangement logic of diagram contents.
static_description: Side panels slide out from edges containing grouped controls for styling and layout adjustments. All interactive widgets use slate gray themed borders/icons.

interaction_and_states.description: Sliders adjust numeric values instantly affecting previewed diagram rendering.
Toggle switches enable/disable auto-layout modes; dropdown menus let users pick predefined themes/styles.

function: Apply ghost white as the primary background tone across main diagramming areas.
static_description: Entire working canvas region uses solid ghost white fill without gradients or patterns ensuring clarity during editing sessions.

function: Implement slate gray coloring scheme consistently throughout secondary UI components like toolbars, sidebars, and dialogs.
static_description: All supporting interface sections feature slate gray typography, outlines, and minor accent visuals maintaining thematic coherence.

resource_dependency.diagramsTableSchema: CREATE TABLE diagrams (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, title TEXT NOT NULL, type VARCHAR(50), created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(), updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(), owner_id INTEGER REFERENCES users(id));
resource_dependency.elementsTableSchema: CREATE TABLE elements (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, diagram_id INTEGER REFERENCES diagrams(id) ON DELETE CASCADE, type VARCHAR(50), position JSONB, style JSONB, content TEXT);
resource_dependency.usersTableSchema: CREATE TABLE users (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, email VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE NOT NULL, password_hash TEXT NOT NULL, created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW());

function: Establish persistent storage layer for managing diagram metadata, constituent parts, and associated user identities via PostgreSQL.
static_description: Database initialized with three tables: users, diagrams, and elements. Connections established using fixed environment variable credentials provided.

apiEndpointsList: GET /api/diagrams - retrieve list of user's diagrams
GET /api/diagrams/:id - fetch full diagram data including elements
PUT /api/diagrams/:id - update diagram metadata and/or element positions/styles
DELETE /api/diagrams/:id - remove entire diagram record and children
resource_dependency.authenticationMiddleware: JWT-based token validation required for accessing protected routes.

function: Expose RESTful HTTP services allowing frontend applications to perform CRUD operations related to diagram management.
static_description: Series of secured API endpoints defined accepting standard HTTP verbs mapped to database transactions involving diagrams and their nested elements.

authSystemEndpoints: POST /api/auth/login - authenticate returning user and issue JWT token

function: Implement authentication mechanism linking diagram ownership to registered user profiles.
static_description: Dedicated auth module handles registration/login flows issuing signed tokens used to authorize subsequent API requests.

resource_dependency.websocketService: Socket.IO server endpoint '/diagram-sync' broadcasting changes to subscribed clients.
resource_dependency.pollingFallbackMechanism: Periodic GET requests to '/api/diagrams/:id' checking last_modified timestamp.

function: Ensure real-time synchronization or timely refresh of displayed diagrams whenever concurrent modifications happen remotely.
static_description: Either WebSocket channel or polling strategy employed depending on deployment capabilities to keep client-side representations synchronized with latest saved states.

resource_dependency.packageJsonScripts: {"scripts": {"install:all": "concurrently \"cd frontend && npm install\" \"cd backend && npm install\"", "dev": "concurrently \"cd frontend && npm run dev\" \"cd backend && npm run dev\""}}

function: Configure package.json scripts to support unified installation and parallel execution of frontend/backend development environments.
static_description: Root-level package.json includes two custom commands leveraging concurrently utility to orchestrate multi-package workflow seamlessly.
